articles.description: Nitish Kumar Reddy hits a superb first Test century to keep India in the fourth Test - but Australia remain in a strong position at the end of day three.
articles.title: Australia v India: Nitish Kumar Reddy hits century in fourth Test

articles.description: There are only two English managers or head coaches in the Premier League, a lower total than ever before - but why?
articles.title: Premier League: Why are there only two English managers in top flight?

articles.description: Ryan Searle loses thriller to Ryan Joyce before wins for Nathan Aspinall and Ricardo Pietreczko at the PDC World Championship.
articles.title: PDC World Darts Championship 2025 results: Ryan Searle out after thriller but Nathan Aspinall advances

articles.description: World number one Scottie Scheffler will miss the first two weeks of the 2025 PGA Tour season after undergoing surgery on a hand injury sustained cooking Christmas dinner.
articles.title: Scottie Scheffler Christmas dinner injury: World number one to miss start of season

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says he will "not give up" as he aims to turn around the champions' recent form.
articles.title: Manchester City: Pep Guardiola 'will not give up' amid poor form

articles.description: Nick Kyrgios says the high-profile doping cases involving Grand Slam winners Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek are "disgusting" for tennis.
articles.title: Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek doping cases 'disgusting' for tennis - Nick Kyrgios

articles.description: Puerto Rico's champion boxer Paul Bamba has died at the age of 35 less than a week after his last fight.
articles.title: Paul Bamba: Puerto Rican champion boxer dies aged 35

articles.description: With out-of-contract players able to speak to clubs abroad from 1 January, which Premier League stars could be lining up a move?
articles.title: Which Premier League players could leave on a free in summer?

articles.description: Bath open up a five-point lead at the top of the Premiership table with a crushing 10-try record victory against 14-man Saracens.
articles.title: Premiership: Bath 68-10 Saracens - hosts open lead at top of table

articles.description: Jaylen Brown scores 44 points as NBA champions the Boston Celtics bounce back from consecutive defeats with a 142-105 victory over the Indiana Pacers.
articles.title: NBA: Jaylen Brown scores 44 points as Boston Celtics dominate the Indiana Pacers
